alert.note: Alert for Iberville; West Baton Rouge (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 04 at 3:39PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTH CENTRAL WEST BATON ROUGE AND CENTRAL IBERVILLE PARISHES THROUGH 415 PM CDT... At 338 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing funnel clouds 7 miles northwest of Bayou Sorrel, or 10 miles west of Plaquemine, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Funnel clouds, winds in excess of 40 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...If a funnel cloud briefly touches down, minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Addis, Rosedale, Grosse Tete, and Ramah. This includes Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 131 and 142. FUNNEL CLOUDS...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
